Tells caching servers/proxies that the content varies depending on user agent (mobile vs desktop)
Directives for caching mechanisms in both requests and responses (e.g. max-age)
Entity Tag; an identifier for a specific version of a resource (helps with caching)
The next generation of HTTP based on QUIC protocol, faster and more reliable
A general-purpose transport layer network protocol designed by Google (reduces latency)
A sequence of characters that specifies a search pattern; used for complex redirects and filtering in GSC
Matches the start of a string
Matches the end of a string
Matches any character zero or more times (wildcard)

q: What is 'Python' use case in SEO?
o: Automating tasks, analyzing large datasets, accessing APIs (GSC, PSI), and scraping
A powerful data analysis and manipulation library
A Python library for pulling data out of HTML and XML files (scraping)
Allows programmatic access to GSC data (query data, inspection) beyond the UI limits
A unique identifier for an entity in Schema, allowing you to connect different data points
Indicates that the item is the same as the item referenced by the URL (e.g. Wikipedia page, Social profile)
Latitude and Longitude marking for a location
A legacy GSC report to debug hreflang errors and set country targeting
Strongest location signal but expensive and separates domain authority
Easy to set up, consolidates authority, but weaker location signal (needs GSC targeting)
Good for disparate content, allows different server location, but authority split is debated
A core update in 2018 that heavily impacted YMYL sites (Health, Finance)
2011 update targeting low-quality, thin content and content farms
2012 update targeting link spam and manipulative link building practices
2013 overhaul of the core algorithm focusing on semantic meaning and conversational search
2014 update focusing on local search results (distance/location parameters)
Unconfirmed 2017 update targeting ad-heavy, low-value affiliate sites
Google ranking a specific passage from a page independently dealing with long content
Algo update rewarding high-quality, authentic reviews with evidence and hands-on testing
A sitewide signal targeting content written for search engines first, rather than humans
An AI-based spam prevention system used by Google
A penalty applied by a human reviewer at Google (appears in GSC)

q: How do you fix a Manual Action?
o: Fix the issue (e.g. remove bad links) and submit a 'Reconsideration Request'
A formal request to Google to review your site after fixing a manual penalty

q: Does a Reconsideration Request work for Algo penalties?

o: Typically new domains, preventing them from ranking for competitive terms immediately
A grey/black hat technique of linking multiple Web 2.0 properties to pass authority
A network of websites used to build links to a single website (Violation of guidelines)
Signs that reveal a network of sites is owned by the same person (same IP, Whois, template)
Hiding the domain owner's contact info from the public Whois database

q: Do keywords in TLD (e.g. .lawyer) assist ranking?
o: Generally no direct ranking boost, but may help relevance/CTR
No longer a requirement for Top Stories carousel; creating good Page Experience is the focus
A tying breaker/lightweight signal; great content still outweighs good CWV
Often used interchangeably, referring to links becoming broken over time
The gradual decline in organic traffic to a piece of content as it becomes outdated or competitors arise
When a user changes their search query to get better results
Frequency with which users return to search results after clicking your link (bad signal if high)
The study of meaning in search queries
A generative statistical model used for topic modeling in NLP

q: What is 'TF-IDF' used for in modern SEO?
o: Understanding keyword prominence vs uniqueness, though modern algos are more complex (vectors)
The frequency with which terms appear together in a dataset (semantic relationship)
How important or central a specific entity is to the text
Determining the attitude (positive, negative, neutral) of a speaker/writer
The ratio of different anchor text types (branded, exact match, generic) pointing to a site
A message from GSC indicating detected link schemes

q: What is a 'Ghost Spam' in Analytics?
o: Fake traffic that never hits your site but appears in Analytics via Measurement Protocol hits
Crawler traffic designed to show up in your referrers list to promote a spam site
A tag management system to deploy code/pixels without modifying code directly
Indirectly; if tags are heavy/slow, it affects speed. Misconfiguration can block bots.
Allows you to test a live URL to see how Google renders it and if it can index it
A visualization tool to turn data (GSC, GA4) into dashboards

q: What is 'Regex' match for valid email simple?
What is 'Google Trends' Search Interest score?

o: Disavowing good links by mistake can drop rankings; Google usually ignores bad links automatically now
The default version shown to users when no other language/region matches
A canonical tag on a page pointing to its own URL (good practice)
Ranking factors intrinsic to the page/domain (Speed, HTTPS) regardless of query
Factors based on the match between query and document (TF-IDF, Relevance)
There is no specific number, but 'appreciably similar' is the standard
Repeated content on many pages (footer, legal text, nav)
Generally identifies and weighs it less than main content

q: What is 'Infinite Scroll' SEO best practice?
o: Use paginated component pages (pushState) so bots can find content below the fold

q: What is 'Googlebot's' user agent string typically?

o: The web crawler for Apple (Siri / Spotlight suggestions)

q: What if you exceed Sitemap limit?
o: Use a Sitemap Index file to point to multiple sitemaps

q: What is 'Needs Met' rating in Quality Rater Guidelines?
o: A rating scale (Fully Met to Fails to Meet) assessing how well a result satisfies the user's mobile query
Segments of a video that can be indexed and displayed with timestamps in search results

q: How to enable Key Moments explicitly?
o: Using 'SeekToAction' schema or providing timestamped description in YouTube
Structured data that displays a 'Licensable' badge on images in Google Images
Optimizing podcast titles, descriptions, and transcripts to appear in Google Podcasts and Search
A set of signals combining Core Web Vitals, Mobile-Friendliness, HTTPS, and No Intrusive Interstitials

q: What is 'Google Discover' policy on misleading headlines?
o: Strictly prohibits clickbait or misleading titles/images
Content placed on your site without your permission due to security vulnerabilities

q: What should you do if your site is hacked?
o: Take site offline, clean code/database, patch vulnerability, and request a review
Spammy accounts posting links on forum profiles or comment sections
Pages with product affiliate links but no unique value or original content (violation)
Text that is the same color as the background, positioned off-screen, or behind images to manipulate ranking
Listing cities or phone numbers without adding value (e.g. at the bottom of a page)

q: What is 'Abuse of Reputation' (Parasite SEO update)?
o: Hosting third-party content solely to exploit the host's ranking signals with little oversight
Generating vast amounts of unoriginal content (AI or scraped) primarily to manipulate search rankings
Buying expired domains to host low-quality content hoping to leverage past authority

q: What is 'Site Reputation Abuse' enforcement status?
o: Google effectively de-indexes or penalizes the specific third-party sections involved
Authorized Digital Sellers; a file to prevent ad fraud by listing authorized sellers of your inventory
A file that allows buyers to discover who the entities are that are either direct sellers or intermediaries
